alert.note: Alert for Knott; Leslie; Letcher; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 11:29PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Letcher, northeastern Leslie, northeastern Perry and western Knott Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1129 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Diablock, or over Hazard, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Jeff and Bulan around 1135 PM EDT. Cordia around 1140 PM EDT. Vicco, Elic, Anco, Wiscoal, Ritchie, Sassafras, Emmalena and Fisty around 1145 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Amburgey, Carrie, Smithsboro, Carr Creek, Cody, Dirk, Bearville, Hindman, Bath, Brinkley, Spider, Littcarr, Tina, Redfox, Vest, Amelia, Pippa Passes, Ivis, Mallie, Garner, Leburn, Pine Top, Drew, Nealy, May and Omaha. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 51 and 59. Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County between mile markers 2 and 14. Kentucky Highway 80 in Perry County between mile markers 9 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
